resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
AlenkaF opened a new pull request, #14074:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14074

   This PR adds:
   - `PYARROW_CXXFLAGS` variable to PyArrow C++ and Pyarrow cmake builds (both defined in `setup.py`)
   - a common flags section to `pyarrow/src/CMakeLists.txt` where `CXX_COMMON_FLAGS` and `PYARROW_CXXFLAGS` are added to the `CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS` variable.
   
   Other flags defined in Arrow C++ should be included in PyArrow C++ and PyArrow with `include(SetupCxxFlags)`.
   
   I am not sure if additional flags that are defined in PyArrow, see: https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/43670af02f0913580fd20e26006fd550d6fdf2da/python/CMakeLists.txt#L134-L174 are needed in PyArrow C++ as they were not used when PyArrow C++ was included in Arrow C++?
   cc @pitrou

pitrou commented on PR #14074:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14074#issuecomment-1245395301

   @AlenkaF You might try this patch to fix the AppVeyor error:
   ```diff
   diff --git a/python/pyarrow/_compute.pyx b/python/pyarrow/_compute.pyx
   index b9594d90e..2aa65e75c 100644
   -

pitrou commented on code in PR #14074:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14074#discussion_r969610984


##########
python/setup.py:
##########
@@ -337,9 +338,10 @@ def _run_cmake(self, pyarrow_cpp_home):
             static_lib_option = ''
 
             cmake_options = [
-                '-DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE=%s' % sys.executable,
-                '-DPython3_EXECUTABLE=%s' % sys.executable,
+                '-DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE=' + str(sys.executable),
+                '-DPython3_EXECUTABLE=' + str(sys.executable),

Review Comment:
   Nit: it should already be a string:
   ```suggestion
                   '-DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE=' + sys.executable,
                   '-DPython3_EXECUTABLE=' + sys.executable,
   ```

pitrou commented on code in PR #14074:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14074#discussion_r969611403


##########
python/setup.py:
##########
@@ -337,9 +338,10 @@ def _run_cmake(self, pyarrow_cpp_home):
             static_lib_option = ''
 
             cmake_options = [
-                '-DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE=%s' % sys.executable,
-                '-DPython3_EXECUTABLE=%s' % sys.executable,
+                '-DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE=' + str(sys.executable),
+                '-DPython3_EXECUTABLE=' + str(sys.executable),

Review Comment:
   Hmm, I see the same idiom is used above actually...

AlenkaF commented on code in PR #14074:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14074#discussion_r969625966


##########
python/setup.py:
##########
@@ -337,9 +338,10 @@ def _run_cmake(self, pyarrow_cpp_home):
             static_lib_option = ''
 
             cmake_options = [
-                '-DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE=%s' % sys.executable,
-                '-DPython3_EXECUTABLE=%s' % sys.executable,
+                '-DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE=' + str(sys.executable),
+                '-DPython3_EXECUTABLE=' + str(sys.executable),

Review Comment:
   Yeah, I am OK with removing it everywhere.

AlenkaF commented on PR #14074:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14074#issuecomment-1246643766

   @pitrou I have added the suggestions and will merge this PR later today if there is no objection.
   
   Note: Travis issue has a [JIRA already](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17715).

ursabot commented on PR #14074:

   ['Python', 'R'] benchmarks have high level of regressions.
   [test-mac-arm](https://conbench.ursa.dev/compare/runs/50a033a17f714fdaba6b6ec1bba6913d...21f43a99eb6f4c3798b0c85e37361763/)

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: In {{setup.py}}, I see that the {{PYARROW_CXXFLAGS}} environment variable is read, but its value then seems to be ignored.

comments.body: I guess so. I think {{self.cmake_cxxflags}} should be added to {{cmake_options}} in {{_run_cmake_pyarrow_cpp}} and {{_run_cmake}} to be red by the CMake when building.
Even if I try to pass {{PYARROW_CXXFLAGS}} directly to CMake, it seems to be used for linking but not compiling, as reported in ARROW-17580.
Oh, got it. Not sure I can help but will for sure dig into it!
